articles.title: FDA approves first treatment for postpartum depression
articles.description: The FDA has approved a new medication called Zulresso, a completely new class of drug designed specifically to treat postpartum depression. It’s a one-time infusion given in a hospital over two and a half days.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Trump calls Kellyanne Conway’s husband ‘a total loser’
articles.description: George Conway has turned into one of the president’s fiercest critics, attacking -- even mocking him -- on a daily basis. He most recently tweeted that President Trump’s “condition is getting worse.”

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Flood emergency devastates Midwestern farms
articles.description: The damage to Nebraska’s agriculture from this week’s floods is estimated to be nearly $1 billion — the latest blow to the farming industry as bankruptcies are on the rise.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Texas petrochemical blaze continues to burn sparking health concerns
articles.description: Authorities initially thought the inferno in Deer Park, Texas would be extinguished by Wednesday, but now have no timetable after the blaze intensified overnight.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Capt. Sullenberger criticizes FAA and Boeing after crashes
articles.description: Captain “Sully” Sullenberger, known for landing a plane full of passengers on the Hudson, wrote an op-ed criticizing the FAA for outsourcing its inspections to Boeing employees, saying it created “conflicts of interest” and damaged credibility.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Patriots owner Robert Kraft offered deal to drop prostitution charges
articles.description: The owner of the New England Patriots and the others who were charged in the prostitution sting may never have to go to court if they accept a plea deal that requires them to admit that the evidence would have been enough to convict.
